item.title: Financial Crises in the 21-st century
item.description: Info When: Friday, 05.04.2019 9:45 to 18:30 Friday, 26.04.2019 11:15 to 18:30 Saturday, 26.04.2019 9:45 to 18:30 ​ Where: West Hall ​ Material: In campus net. ​Mainstream economics is about isolating key questions that may be analysed in a theoretical framework. In practice the economy is an extremely complex global phenomenon, where everything happens as an outcome of the interaction of millions of people. The goal of this course is to provide a bridge between the theory and practice in economics from the perspective of the global financial crisis.
